results.title: One kitten for Kim
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a boy with seven kittens who is told by his parents that he may only keep one and must give the rest away. Encourages discussion of Kim’s adventures, the reactions of his parents and the experience of lower grade students of finding homes for pets. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: One in every hundred
results.creator_credit: Maurice Hatton, Richard De La Mare, Intertel and Rediffusion
results.brief_description: The problem of the mentally handicapped. Shows how parents and institutions cope with retarded children and adults, showing a wide range of situations in England and Canada. Special schools and adult training centres are shown, and it is emphasised that less severe cases are able to learn enough to support themselves and are better living in normal society than institutionalised.

results.title: One hundred and forty days under the world
results.creator_credit: Kell Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with one summer’s work by New Zealand scientists in the Ross Dependency in the Antarctic, and the exploration of some of the last unmapped regions. Shows expeditions designed to gather scientific data on the weather, animal life in the area and shifting ice patterns.

results.title: One giant step
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Film shows how new technology is being used in the rehabilitation of the physically disabled. The range of aids available, from environmental control systems to communications aids are examined

results.title: One giant leap
results.creator_credit: Richard Dunn, Associated British-Pathe, Educational Media and Special Films Group
results.brief_description: Excellent historical footage is used in this film to trace the development of the rocket up to the first landing of man on the moon. The programs of the United States and Russia are shown, and a relatively unbiased account of successes and failures from Sputnik to Apollo is given.

results.title: One film, three scripts
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Present day Puerto Rico is the subject of this film, but the film’s innovative format provides an unusual opportunity to study communication techniques. The same film footage is repeated three times accompanied by three distinct and doctrinaire texts. The viewer is thereby challenged to evaluate whose “faith is being propagated” and by what means.

results.title: One day in perfect health
results.creator_credit: John Krish and Data Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, showing the work being done in combating tropical diseases. The film refers to the School’s early history and some of the famous scientists associated with it. To this school, and its hospital, come doctors and students from many countries to learn and study at first hand diseases such as malaria, sleeping sickness, and leprosy. The film was made for the British Central Office of Information.

results.title: One day's poison
results.creator_credit: Donald Wilder, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Describes the work of the poison control centre at the Toronto Sick Children’s Hospital, using dramatised incidents to illustrate the variety and number of accidental poisoning’s among children. (Award: Toronto.)
